did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Deans' And Directors' Meetings Records1967-1981
did.abstract: Records of informal meetings attended by deans of academic schools and directors of university facilities.

origination.corpname: State University of New York at Albany. Deans' And Directors' Meetings

did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: M. E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University at Albany, SUNY

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The Department of Special Collections and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records were donated to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives, University Libraries by M.E. Grenander, by Kenneth D. Mosher, Jr., Class of 1946 in 1998.1998

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Deans' and Directors' Meetings were informal meetings attended by deans of academic schools and directors of University facilities with the Academic Vice President presiding. The exact date at which these meetings began is unknown, but records in this collection begin in 1967. The purpose of these meetings was to provide and open forum for the discussion of matters of academic and administrative concern to the deans and directors of the University.

The record group also contains the records of the separate Conference of Deans of Faculties. The purpose of this group was to "serve as a continuing advisory body to the Vice-President of Academic Affairs." Specifically, it advised on "allocations of resources, future development of new and established program areas, and educational strategies for achieving University goals." (Memorandum from the Acting Vice-President for Academic Affairs to Charles Colman, et. al., 10/22/1970.) The Conference of Academic Deans met every other week following the Deans' and Directors' Meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The records of Deans' and Directors' Meetings are an unofficial record of this group. This collection has been taken from the files of Dean Warren Haynes, School of Business, Associate Dean Charles Colman, School of Humanities, and circa James Schmidt, Director of University Libraries, as well as other deans and directors. Included in these files are minutes of meetings, memoranda, extensive documentation on the creation of budgets, allocations, admissions and enrollment figures, numerous reports on tenure and term appointment, and handwritten minutes by the aforementioned Deans and Directors. In addition, discussion can be found on major issues confronting the University such as student unrest in the late 1960's and the cancellation of many programs at the State University of New York at Albany due to state budget cuts in the mid-1970's.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection has no series, arranged chronologically.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Deans' And Directors' Meetings Records, 1967-1981. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Deans' And Directors' Meetings Records).

did.unittitle: Agendas and minutes

Agendas and minutes - Includes a statement of policy for the Conference of Deans of Faculties; Rules and Regulations for Maintenance of Public Order; and the Report of Ad Hoc Committee on Term Appointments.
Agendas and minutes - Includes a memorandum on the establishment of Conference of Academic Deans.
Agendas and minutes - Includes a summary report by Committee on Campus Unrest, a proposal for the establishment of the University Archives, and an Ecological Policy for SUNY
Agendas and minutes - Includes "Proposal of Resource Management."
Agendas and minutes - Includes "Statement on Professional Ethics."
Agendas and minutes - Contains "Report on Future Decline of College Aged Students."
Agendas and minutes - Contains Business School Accreditation by AACSB.
Agendas and minutes - Contains "Procedures for Promotion and Continuing Appointments."
Agendas and minutes - Includes the "Preliminary Bylaws for SUNYA Council of Academic Deans."
Agendas and minutes - Includes "Confidential Report on Recommended Program Cuts."
Agendas and minutes - Contains "Grievance Procedure for Review of Allegations of Discrimination."
Agendas and minutes - Includes reports by Acting Director of Planning on national enrollment trends, enrollment trends at SUNYA,and enrollment trends for minorities and women.
Agendas and minutes - Includes a report to Undergradute Academic Council "Goal of a Liberal Education."
Agendas and minutes
Agendas and minutes
Agendas and minutes - Includes staff report, "Regents Higher Education Planning."
Agendas and minutes - Includes report, "Measurement of Teaching Effectiveness."
